game.name: Y
game.board: Y is played on a triangular board tiled with hexagonal spaces.
game.pieces: The first player places stones of one color and the second player places stones of another color.
game.tomove: Place one of your stones on an empty space on the board. You may not place your stone on a space already containing another stone.
game.towin: Connect the three sides of the board with your stones. Placing a stone on a corner space counts as connecting two sides.
game.rules: In the following example, the player placing blue stones has connected all three sides of the board.[img src="y.svg" width="300" height="300"]

variant.name: Sidelength
variant.description: The board can have any sidelength N where N is the number of hexagons on the side of the triangular board.
